package.description:
This package contains version 2.7.5 of the Bullet professional free 3D Game Multiphysics Library. The ROS package automatically downloads, extracts and compiles a tarball. For each major release of the Bullet library, the tarball will get updated. The Bullet library provided by this ROS package is slightly different form the official Bullet release.
To eliminate ambiguity about which API is active the btQuaternion constructor from Euler angles is deprecated.
The btMatrix3x3 and btQuaternion setEulerZYX and getEulerZYX methods are deprecated. The goal of these deprecations is to remove the existing patch against Bullet which makes them consistent. They will be deprecated for a few releases, then patched out for a few releases before being reintroduced in their native form.
There are a few errors in documentation and btMatrix3x3::getEulerYPR has been changed to be a pass through to getEulerZYX for it is a better implementation of the same method. These are filed under issue 282 http://code.google.com/p/bullet/issues/detail?id=282
For standardization and continuity Fixed Axis getRPY and setRPY methods have been added to btQuaternion and btMatrix3x3. These will be pushed back to Bullet, and hopefully accepted. These are the same format as used by kdl and gazebo. Standardization survey and decision at http://www.ros.org/wiki/tf/Reviews/Euler_Angle_Usage_2009-09-02_API_Review These patches have been pushed back in issue 285 http://code.google.com/p/bullet/issues/detail?id=285 This patch will be maintained in parallel if Bullet does not accept it.
There is a patch against the btQuaternion angle and getAngle methods to clamp floating point errors to prevent nan results. See http://code.google.com/p/bullet/issues/detail?id=98
We have the intention to move towards the official version of Bullet; this however will take some time because it involves a number of deprecation cycles for the conflicting quaternion constructor.
